paragraphs.az_text_area:
Grid

The Grid display shows each of your images as a thumbnail in a uniform grid. If you click on one of the thumbnails, it will display the full image + caption as an overlay slideshow on top of the rest of the page.

Slider

The Slider display shows each of your images + caption as a slide in a slideshow. The slideshow is the same width as the rest of your page content.

Text with Background can be added to any Page to enhance your page content. Customization options are available for background color, background pattern, and full or content width backgrounds.

View all background color and pattern combinations

Accessibile Color Combinations

It's up to YOU to ensure text colors are legible on your selected background color! We created a handy tool for you to see which brand colors pass the accessibility guidelines.

View our color accessibility tool and check the "Hide inaccessible color combinations." box.

Examples

What this site is for

To make sure that:

  • Our complete Quickstart code base builds successfully after every merged pull request
  • We always have a reference point to compare pending changes to
  • We have a baseline website that uses almost everything in Quickstart so that we can identify visual regressions.

Arizona Quickstart is built by Arizona Digital and styled with Arizona Bootstrap.

Text is the most common type of Page element. It can do wonderful things like style text, embed images and files, make lists, and add tables and grids. Below are some examples of what this "What You See is What You Get" (WYSIWYG) editor can do.

Headings (H2)

Headings communicate the organization of the content on the page. Web browsers, plug-ins, and assistive technologies can use them to provide in-page navigation (source).

A Heading 1 (H1) is always the title of the page. A Heading 2 (H2) indicates a new section of content on the page.

How to Use Headings (H3)

This next heading is a Heading 3 (H3) because it is a subsection of "Headings (H2)". You can think about headings like bulleted or numbered lists. If content is at the same level, they are expected to contain different content. If content is nested within a list item, it is expected that content is related to the list item above it.

Example of Headings (H4)

Headings should section your content similar to how nested bullets section out list content.

  • Heading 1 (H1) is always the page title
    • Heading 2 (H2) is a section of content on the page
      • Heading 3 (H3) is a section within the H2
        • Heading 4 (H4) is a section within the H3
    • Heading 2 (H2) is a section of content on the page
      • Heading 3 (H3) is a section within the H2
      • Heading 3 (H3) is a section within the H2
    • Heading 2 (H2) is a section of content on the page

Grids

Grids are used when you want to style content in different columns. They automatically stack on mobile devices.

Tables

Tables are used when you have "if, then" style content that needs to be related to each other. Tables should never be used for layout (use grids instead!).

Row 1 Heading Row 2 Heading
Content of row 1 Content of row 2 related to column 1
Content of row 1 Content of row 2 related to column 1
